University Website   Virtual Tour of Chulalongkorn University     **If you are interested in applying to study on IBEX at Chulalongkorn University please email uc.international@stern.nyu.edu directly**             Program Overview                                              About Chulalongkorn University                                    " Chulalongkorn University is the oldest and one of the most prestigious universities in Thailand. Founded in 1917 by King Vajiravudh (Rama VI), the university was named as a tribute to the king's royal father, King Chulalongkorn (Rama V). Over a period of time, Chulalongkorn University, or Chula for short, has grown to become a full-fledged university. Today, Chula has eighteen faculties, a graduate school, eleven research institutes, three teaching institutes, and four affiliated institutions with more than 2,800 faculty members. The Chulalongkorn University campus covers 500 acres in the heart of Bangkok, the capital of Thailand. The campus is within reach of the major business and financial district, as well as various other facilities." - Chulalongkorn University                                 Term Dates                                        Fall Semester: mid-August to mid-December    Spring Semester: mid-January to mid-May     Note: Dates are approximate and may be subject to change                                 Approximate Living Expenses                                        Housing: ฿10,000 to 22,000/month    Food: ฿100-500/day    Transportation: ฿50-110/day    Textbooks: ฿1,000/book     Note: ฿ = Baht                                 Language of Instruction                                    English                                 Housing                                    Chulalongkorn University has an on campus residence named CU i House that is available for international students. Monthly accommodation fees vary according to room type ranging from THB 10,000 to 22,000/month.                                 Student Services                                    Chulalongkorn has a Friendship Club that arranges a buddy program for exchange students.                                 Additional Information                                    Students wear Chula uniforms consisting of white shirts and blue or black skirts or pants inside the classroom                     Show all | Hide all                                                Did You Know?    Enjoy Bangkok's unique exotic culture while also attending courses with the academic elite of Thailand at their oldest university where a member of the royal family distributes the degrees at graduation                 Chulalongkorn Course Information                    Student Profiles & Evaluations                                                                 Stern Around the World     Barr Family International Studies Program (ISP)   Semester Away NYU Study Away   International Business Exchange Program (IBEX) Why go on IBEX? Global Leadership Scholars Program                                                                   Contact Us      New York University's Office of Global Programs consists of two administrative offices in New York and 11 Global Academic Centers in: Accra, Berlin, Buenos Aires, Florence, London, Madrid, Paris, Prague, Sydney, Tel Aviv, and Washington, DC.   The New York Offices answer general questions about admissions, operations, academics and preparing to go abroad. Site representatives are available in New York to answer questions about all academic centers abroad. Other NYU departments answer questions about billing, student health matters, and financial assistance.              To report a student emergency at any NYU location in the world, call NYU's Department of Public Safety at (US 001) 212-998-2222, (24 hours).                                          About Chulalongkorn University                                    " Chulalongkorn University is the oldest and one of the most prestigious universities in Thailand. Founded in 1917 by King Vajiravudh (Rama VI), the university was named as a tribute to the king's royal father, King Chulalongkorn (Rama V). Over a period of time, Chulalongkorn University, or Chula for short, has grown to become a full-fledged university. Today, Chula has eighteen faculties, a graduate school, eleven research institutes, three teaching institutes, and four affiliated institutions with more than 2,800 faculty members. The Chulalongkorn University campus covers 500 acres in the heart of Bangkok, the capital of Thailand. The campus is within reach of the major business and financial district, as well as various other facilities." - Chulalongkorn University                                 Term Dates                                        Fall Semester: mid-August to mid-December    Spring Semester: mid-January to mid-May     Note: Dates are approximate and may be subject to change                                 Approximate Living Expenses                                        Housing: ฿10,000 to 22,000/month    Food: ฿100-500/day    Transportation: ฿50-110/day    Textbooks: ฿1,000/book     Note: ฿ = Baht                                 Language of Instruction                                    English                                 Housing                                    Chulalongkorn University has an on campus residence named CU i House that is available for international students. Monthly accommodation fees vary according to room type ranging from THB 10,000 to 22,000/month.                                 Student Services                                    Chulalongkorn has a Friendship Club that arranges a buddy program for exchange students. Global Leadership Scholars Program                                                                   Contact Us      New York University's Office of Global Programs consists of two administrative offices in New York and 11 Global Academic Centers in: Accra, Berlin, Buenos Aires, Florence, London, Madrid, Paris, Prague, Sydney, Tel Aviv, and Washington, DC.   The New York Offices answer general questions about admissions, operations, academics and preparing to go abroad. Site representatives are available in New York to answer questions about all academic centers abroad. Other NYU departments answer questions about billing, student health matters, and financial assistance. Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Chulalongkorn University  Bangkok, Thailand     Chulalongkorn University Website   Virtual Tour of Chulalongkorn University     **If you are interested in applying to study on IBEX at Chulalongkorn University please email uc.international@stern.nyu.edu directly**             Program Overview                                              About Chulalongkorn University                                    " Chulalongkorn University is the oldest and one of the most prestigious universities in Thailand. Founded in 1917 by King Vajiravudh (Rama VI), the university was named as a tribute to the king's royal father, King Chulalongkorn (Rama V). Over a period of time, Chulalongkorn University, or Chula for short, has grown to become a full-fledged university. Today, Chula has eighteen faculties, a graduate school, eleven research institutes, three teaching institutes, and four affiliated institutions with more than 2,800 faculty members. The Chulalongkorn University campus covers 500 acres in the heart of Bangkok, the capital of Thailand. The campus is within reach of the major business and financial district, as well as various other facilities." - Chulalongkorn University                                 Term Dates                                        Fall Semester: mid-August to mid-December    Spring Semester: mid-January to mid-May     Note: Dates are approximate and may be subject to change                                 Approximate Living Expenses                                        Housing: ฿10,000 to 22,000/month    Food: ฿100-500/day    Transportation: ฿50-110/day    Textbooks: ฿1,000/book     Note: ฿ = Baht                                 Language of Instruction                                    English                                 Housing                                    Chulalongkorn University has an on campus residence named CU i House that is available for international students. Monthly accommodation fees vary according to room type ranging from THB 10,000 to 22,000/month.                                 Student Services                                    Chulalongkorn has a Friendship Club that arranges a buddy program for exchange students.                                 Additional Information                                    Students wear Chula uniforms consisting of white shirts and blue or black skirts or pants inside the classroom                     Show all | Hide all                                                Did You Know?    Enjoy Bangkok's unique exotic culture while also attending courses with the academic elite of Thailand at their oldest university where a member of the royal family distributes the degrees at graduation                 Chulalongkorn Course Information                    Student Profiles & Evaluations                                                                 Stern Around the World     Barr Family International Studies Program (ISP)   Semester Away NYU Study Away   International Business Exchange Program (IBEX) Why go on IBEX? Global Leadership Scholars Program                                                                   Contact Us      New York University's Office of Global Programs consists of two administrative offices in New York and 11 Global Academic Centers in: Accra, Berlin, Buenos Aires, Florence, London, Madrid, Paris, Prague, Sydney, Tel Aviv, and Washington, DC.   The New York Offices answer general questions about admissions, operations, academics and preparing to go abroad. Site representatives are available in New York to answer questions about all academic centers abroad. Other NYU departments answer questions about billing, student health matters, and financial assistance.              To report a student emergency at any NYU location in the world, call NYU's Department of Public Safety at (US 001) 212-998-2222, (24 hours).
